inclusion.criterion: Pregnant women lacking evidence of acute CMV infection
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: negative IgM antibody (<1.00 Index) and negative IgG antibody (<6.0 AU/ml)

inclusion.criterion: Gestational age during CMV screening will be no later than 20 weeks based on clinical information and evaluation of the earliest ultrasound.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Enrollment will occur no later than 20 weeks' gestation.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Singleton pregnancy. A twin pregnancy reduced to singleton (either spontaneously or therapeutically) before 20 weeks' by project gestational age is acceptable.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: English and Spanish-speaking women of any age will be offered enrollment
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Women with a previous child with congenital CMV
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Intention of leaving the prenatal practice
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known major fetal anomalies or demise
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 19 yo Hispanic female G1P1 at 32+ 6 weeks of gestational age. BP of 146/99 and urine dipstick with 3+ proteins.
